h3.div: Liberty Hill ISD Counselors are available for you should you need someone to talk to during this time.
Please click your school link listed below.
Counselors' Google Forms and emails are not monitored 24/7 and should not be used in case of an emergency.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: If you or someone you know is experiencing a mental health emergency, please call 911.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: Links for Mental Health & Community Supports

div.p: The links presented are informational and intended to provide resources to families, but are not intended as a substitute for assistance from a qualified mental health professional. In addition, inclusion of these links is not meant to imply an endorsement by Liberty Hill Independent School District. Liberty Hill Independent School District is not responsible for the content on these sites.

div.a: RESOURCES FOR DISCUSSING COVID-19 & SUPPORTING CHILDREN
SUPPORTING GENERAL MENTAL HEALTH IN CHILDREN & ADOLESCENTS
COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND LOCAL MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: RESOURCES FOR DISCUSSING COVID-19 & SUPPORTING CHILDREN

p.a: COVID-19 Mental Health Support Line (English)
Talking to Children About COVID-19 (Coronavirus): A Parent Resource
Talking to Kids About the Coronavirus
“Don’t Share Your Germs!” Social Story About Staying Healthy
Flu Social Story
Just For Kids: A Comic Exploring The New Coronavirus
Supporting your Children’s Social, Emotional, and Mental Health During the COVID-19 Pandemic
Supporting Teenagers and Young Adults During the Coronavirus Crisis
Parent/Caregiver Guide to Helping Families Cope With the Coronavirus Disease 2019
Age-Related Reactions to a Traumatic Event
Helping Children Cope with Emergencies
Coronavirus Brain Pop
Coping Skills for Dealing with Stress/Anxiety Regarding Coronavirus (COVID-19)
Sample Schedules For Kids Home From School During Coronavirus Outbreak
Coronavirus: What Kids Can Do
COVID-19 Mental Health Support Line (Spanish)
"Achu!" - Libro de Actividades
Cómo ayudar a los niños a sobrellevar las emergencias
Hable con sus hijos sobre el COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Un recurso para padres
Guía de ayuda para padres y cuidadores para ayudar a las familias a enfrentar la enfermedad Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19)

h3.div: SUPPORTING GENERAL MENTAL HEALTH IN CHILDREN & ADOLESCENTS

p.a: Teach Kids These Breathing Techniques To Control Big Emotions
Your Guide to Managing Indoor Boredom
Simple Activities for Children and Adolescents
On our Sleeves Conversation Starters
Cosmic Kids Yoga/Mindfulness Activities
Stop Breathe Think
Stress Management
Ways to Cope in Trying Times
Calm. Take a deep breath.
Coping With Stress During Infectious Disease Outbreaks
Taking Care of Yourself
Taking Care of Your Behavioral Health
How School Closures Can Strengthen Your Family
Coping with coronavirus anxiety
NAMI Covid-19 (CORONAVIRUS) Information and Resources

a.strong: Aunt Bertha - The Social Care Network

div.p: Food Pantry Hours: Tuesday 9am-5pm, Thursday Noon-6pm
The Thrift Store is closed until further notice.
Please arrive at least 30 minutes prior to closing to complete paperwork in order to receive food the same day.
Drive Thru Pantry Hours: Tuesday and Thursday 10am-12pm
Thrift Stores are closed until further notice.

h3.div: COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND LOCAL MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS

a.strong: Grace Grego Maxwell Mental Health Unit

p.strong: Austin State Hospital (ASH) (Ages 3-17 children's unit, 18+ adult unit)
United Way Free Info on Health and Human Services -- 211 for non-emergency help
Department of State Health Services (DSHS) -- Dial 211
Emotional Support Help Line for COVID-19 -- 1-866-342-6892

div.p: Free access to specially trained mental health specialists to support people experiencing anxiety or stress around COVID-19.
